class data.components.input.InputBinder(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Observer

Class for binding inputs to execute callables via the observer algorithm.

deregister(*inputs: tuple[Literal['key', 'keydown', 'keyup', 'mouse', 'mousedown', 'mouseup', 'quit'], int])[source]
Parameters:

inputs – A tuple of the type and input that the action should be unregistered from.

notify(input_manager: InputManager)[source]

Calls the registered handler.

Parameters:

  • inputs – A tuple of the type and input.

  • action – The action to call upon the input being detected.

is_key_down(key: int)[source]

Checks if key is currently being pressed down (only happens at the very beginning of the keypress).

Parameters:

key – The key to check for.

Returns:

True if key is in the keydown_events list.

is_key_pressed(key: int)[source]

Checks if key is currently being held down.

Parameters:

key – The key to check for.

Returns:

True if key is in the held_keys list.

is_key_up(key: int)[source]

Checks if the key is currently being released (only happens at the very end of the keypress).

Parameters:

key – The key to check for.

Returns:

True if key is in the keyup_events list.

is_mouse_down(button: int)[source]

Checks if the mouse button is currently being pressed (only happens at the very beginning of the button press).

Parameters:

button – The mousebutton to check for.

Returns:

True if mousebutton is in the mousedown_events list.

Checks if the mouse button is being held down.

Parameters:

button – The mousebutton to check for.

Returns:

True if button is in the mouse_buttons list.

is_mouse_up(button: int)[source]

Checks if the mouse button is currently being released (only happens at the very end of the button press).

Parameters:

button – The mousebutton to check for.

Returns:

True if the mousebutton is in the mouseup_events list.

Clears keydown and keyup events, iterates through pygame events and updates the input lists as necessary.

data.components.shift_rgb(rgb_color, shift_amount)[source]

Shifts the color in the RGB spectrum by the specified amount.

Parameters:

  • rgb_color – A tuple of (R, G, B) values where each is in the range 0-255.

  • shift_amount – The amount to shift the color in the spectrum.

Returns:

A tuple of (R, G, B) representing the shifted color.
